main event: On November 26, 1954, in Millville, N.J., a civilian observed a round, yellowish-red light that hovered and then moved rapidly to the northeast for 23 minutes. The report suggests that the observation was possibly an optical illusion created by searchlights operating in the area.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for 23 minutes, providing a substantial duration for observation.
The object was described as having round, yellowish-red lights and moved rapidly to the northeast.
There were no photographs or movies of the sighting, limiting the visual evidence of the event.
The report suggests that the observation may have been an optical illusion caused by searchlights in the area, possibly for airplanes.
It is noted that the CAA reported no lights in the vicinity, and the observer was not able to provide further details about the sighting.
